description.narrative: Government and other partners have increased capacity at the national and sub-national levels for humanitarian coordination and delivery of quality nutrition services, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs and international standards., which contributes to Supply And Logistics, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: NUTRITION Outcome: Improved coverage and increased utilization of quality and equitable nutrition services for under five children, adolescent girls and mothers in most deprived provinces and areas.

DOPH TAKHAR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH
ORGANIZATION FOR COMMUNITY COORDINATION AND DEVELOPMENT

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and other partners have increased capacity at the national and sub-national levels for humanitarian coordination and delivery of quality nutrition services, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs and international standards.

description.narrative: Due to COVID-19, an increase from 690,000 children to 780,000 affected by Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) is estimated. The programmatic adaptations for SAM treatment during COVID-19 has contributed in reaching 133,374 children aged 6-59 months with lifesaving treatment services, lower than the expected target because of restriction in movements. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of children aged 6 - 59 months among emergency affected communities receiving Vit A Supplementation
In humanitarian situations: Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
Number of staff have adequate knowledge on cluster coordination mechanism
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
Percentage of health and nutrition workers trained on management of SAM as per national standards
Existence of an emergency preparedness plan for nutrition
